meanings.definition: The arrangement or disposition of people or things in relation to each other.
meanings.sent1: The orders of the books on the shelf were by size.
meanings.sent2: She followed the orders of the teacher and lined up alphabetically.
meanings.sent3: The orders of the toys in the playroom seemed to change every day.
meanings.sent4: The orders of the flowers in the garden created a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent5: The orders of the chairs in the waiting room made it look neat and organized.

meanings.definition: A request for something to be made, supplied, or served.
meanings.sent1: He placed an order for a pizza with extra cheese.
meanings.sent2: The customer's order for a new phone was processed quickly.
meanings.sent3: The order for a unicorn at the zoo made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her order for a million dollars was unfortunately not fulfilled.
meanings.sent5: The order for a rainbow cake made the birthday party extra special.

meanings.definition: A command given by a superior.
meanings.sent1: The general issued orders for the troops to advance.
meanings.sent2: Following the doctor's orders, she took her medicine every day.
meanings.sent3: The order from the principal to wear pajamas to school was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The order from the king to build a castle was carried out diligently.
meanings.sent5: The order from the captain to set sail filled the sailors with excitement.
